items.title: Owncast discussion series: The Fediverse
items.content_html: With the next release of Owncast there are features that supports your Owncast instance interacting with the greater Fediverse. In this discussion we go over what this means and what functionality it unlocks for streamers.

items.title: Welcome to the Fediverse, Owncast streamers!
items.content_html:
Owncast v0.0.11 is now available, and with it brings Owncast to the Fediverse.

With these features people can follow your server and get alerted to when you go live. Additionally, as people engage with your live notifications outside of your server it will show up in your chat. This encourages people to share your stream and get a bit of recognition for doing so.

You can also compose posts within the Owncast admin to send to your followers, alerting people to your stream plans, or to remind followers that you’re still streaming and to come visit, for example.

Enable this in the admin under the “Social” section.

This is all new functionality to Owncast, so please share your experiences or any issues you run into. There’s lots of different implementations out there, so it’s not uncommon to have to work through specific incompatibilities as time goes on.

The full documentation for these new features can be found here, and I look forward to seeing all of your Owncast servers joining the Fediverse!

items.title: How Do You Use Owncast?
items.content_html:
Could you take a second and answer two very short questions to help influence the future of Owncast?

We want to build things that are most useful to you, but to do that we’d like to hear, generally, what category of streaming you’ve been using Owncast for.

Answer here.

Your time and feedback is much appreciated!
